summary: The Wyoming Public Lands Initiative Act of 2025 proposes to designate several areas in Wyoming as wilderness areas, managed by the Bureau of Land Management, and as components of the National Wilderness Preservation System. It also addresses the release of certain Wilderness Study Areas, establishes new Special Management Areas (including National Conservation Areas), and mandates studies for motorized recreation areas in Fremont, Hot Springs, and Washakie Counties. The bill outlines specific management provisions for these areas, including regulations for grazing, fire management, motorized vehicle use, and resource extraction, while also considering land exchanges and addressing specific land uses within the established areas.
